evidence.pdf_reference: the remarkable photocatalytic performance.This work is anticipated to provide new pathway for designing efficient perovskite-based photocatalyst in energy conversion applications.

were tested under a 300 W Xenon lamp with a 420 nm filter to eliminate the ultraviolet light. The CO 2 photoreduction tests were performed in a 50 mL sealed Pyrex bottle, which was filled with 8 mg of photocatalyst, 100 mL of deionized water and 30 mL of acetonitrile.In this experiment, acetonitrile was chosen as the solvent on account of its mild polarity for stabilization of CsPbBr 3 and high solvability of CO 2 .After the reaction system was evacuated completely, it was refilled with high purity CO 2 .A

3 composites were applied as catalysts for artificial CO 2 photoreduction under visible light.As shown in Fig. 8(a), CH 4 and CO were the main reduction products for all the samples, with no H 2 or other species detected, suggesting a high selectivity of CO 2 reduction.The CO 2 reduction activity of pristine CsPbBr 3 was quite poor, with the yields of CH 4 and CO as low as 15.7 and 31.1 mmol g A1 after 4 h of reaction, respectively.As expected, all the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 When the content of MWCNT further

the highly conductive MWCNT acts as an electron acceptor to inhibit the carrier recombination in the CsPbBr 3 QDs.When the content of MWCNT was 4.0 wt, the resultant CsPbBr 3 MWCNT exhibited the optimum photocatalytic performance, with the yields of CO and CH 4 3.14 and 2.13 times that of pristine CsPbBr 3 QDs, respectively.The rapid electron extraction and transfer from CsPbBr 3 QDs to MWCNT, as well as the enhanced visible light harvesting ability accounted for the remarkable photocatalytic

artificial photosynthesis. In addition, the reusability of the photocatalyst was of great importance for its practical applications, so the catalytic stability of the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite was evaluated by cyclic experiments.As shown in Fig. 8(c), the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite (4 wt ) could maintain reproducible photocatalytic performance after three successive cycling runs.Meanwhile, the recycled MWCNT CsPbBr 3 composite could preserve the phase, morphology and valence states after photocatalytic CO 2

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

infrared (FT-IR) spectra was conducted on a spectrometer (Nicolet iN10, Frontier) in KBr pellet.Raman spectra were recorded on a Horiba Scientific Raman spectrometer using a 633 nm laser light.The UVevis absorption behaviors were investigated using a UVevis spectrometer (PE Lambda 900).Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were obtained from an fluorescence spectrometer (Edinburgh FLS 9800) with 365 nm excitation.The time-resolved photoluminescence (TRPL) were recorded on the same instrument, and a triexponential

were tested under a 300 W Xenon lamp with a 420 nm filter to eliminate the ultraviolet light. The CO 2 photoreduction tests were performed in a 50 mL sealed Pyrex bottle, which was filled with 8 mg of photocatalyst, 100 mL of deionized water and 30 mL of acetonitrile.In this experiment, acetonitrile was chosen as the solvent on account of its mild polarity for stabilization of CsPbBr 3 and high solvability of CO 2 .After the reaction system was evacuated completely, it was refilled with high purity CO 2 .A

and a triexponential decay kinetic was used to calculate the average PL lifetimes (t average ): . Photoelectrochemical characterizations were performed on a CHI 650E three electrode cell with a reference electrode of AgAgCl, a counter electrode of Pt mesh, and a working electrode of CsPbBr 3 QDs or MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composites on FTO glass.Tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (TBAPF 6 ) dissolved in ethyl acetate (0.1 M) was used as the electrolyte.Photoelectrochemical measurements were tested under a 300 W

can also reflect the charge separation efficiency intuitively.As shown in Fig. 9(a), the amperometric i-t curves exhibited highly repeatable photocurrent density upon light onoff cycles.The MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite showed a 50 enhancement of photocurrent responses compared with the pristine CsPbBr 3 QDs, profitting from the excellent electrical conductivity of MWCNT.Additionally, the charge transport behavior of the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite was further evaluated by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy

could function act as electron sinks, thus retarding the recombination of photo-generated carriers 48.In the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite, MWCNT was believed to play a similar role to the previous studies.It can not only accept the photogenerated electrons from CsPbBr 3 QDs, but also provide an electron transfer channel due to its special conductive network, which facilitated the charge separation and migration rate, thus leading to enhanced photocatalytic performance of the MWCNTCsPbBr 3 composite in CO 2
